problem_text:
c) The I-theory (Q-theory) of a class K of universal algebras is the totality of all identities (quasi-identities) that are valid on all algebras in K. Does there exist a finitely axiomatizable variety
(3) of Lie rings
(i) whose I-theory is non-decidable?
Remark: it is not difficult to find a recursively axiomatizable variety of semigroups with identity whose I-theory is non-recursive (see also A. I. Mal’cev, Mat. Sbornik, 69, no. 1 (1966), 3–12 (Russian)).
A. I. Mal’cev
